task-wr.title: Using a Controller Configuration Input File
task-wr.shortdesc: For automated installation, you can create a configuration file to use with the controller configuration script.

context.p: US62804 new topicThe controller configuration script accepts a path to a configuration file as an optional parameter:
where filename is the path and name of the file.
context.draft-comment: US75548 Titanium Server CPE - new Note

note.p: The config_controller controller configuration script will verify the installed software as either Titanium Server CPE or Titanium Server standard product against the provided license file. It will be rejected if the license file and the installed software do not match.

context.p: US63902 and US63694 add (JO update: refer to SDK)The configuration file contains all the settings required by the script, expressed using INI format. You can create one manually, or you can use the configuration file generator utility provided with the Titanium Server Guest Software Development Kit (SDK). For more about the format, see . For information about the configuration file generator utility, see the documentation included with the SDK.

US63902 and US63694 add ( (JO update: refer to SDK))You can validate a configuration file before applying it, using the config_validator utility provided with the SDK. The same validation is also performed automatically when the configuration controller script is executed. For information about the configuration file validator utility, see the documentation included with the SDK.
addedFor general information about the SDK, see the Titanium Server Software Development Kit.

note.p: The configuration file contains clear-text authentication data. For improved security, delete this file from the system after use.
